title: Liberals splinter as momentum builds towards dumping net zero | ABC NEWS
description: Sussan Ley is putting pressure on Labor over its economic management, but struggling to cut through with the Coalition consumed by internal climate debate. The opposition leader is facing a critical decision with momentum building within the Liberals to dump net zero, although several moderates remain commited to the climate pledge. title: Maldives successfully passes generational ban on tobacco products  | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The Maldives has made history as the only country in the world to successfully legislate a generational tobacco ban for anyone born on or after 01 January 2007. The president Mohamed Muizzu initiated and signed the bill, banning the next generation from any tobacco products. Professor Coral Gartner is the director of the NHMRC centre of research excellence on achieving the tobacco endgame at the University of Queensland and told The World other countries around the globe have previously considered this policy.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Mamdani vs Cuomo: How New York mayoral race could redefine US politics | The World | ABC News
description: Voters are heading to the polls in New York City to elect their next mayor, in a race the whole world is watching. The latest polling data suggests Democratic candidate Zohran Mamdani is ahead against independent Andrew Cuomo who has been endorsed by President Donald Trump and Republican Curtis Sliwa. New York Magazine columnist Ross Barkan has worked closely with Zohran Mamdani and wrote a book on Andrew Cuomo. He discusses the possible outcomes and implications on US politics with The World's Girish Sawlani.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Top Israeli military lawyer arrested over leaked prison video | The World | ABC NEWS
description: She was formerly the Israel Defence Force's top legal adviser, but Major General Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi is now in police custody after she admitted to authorising the leaking of a video back in August 2024. It showed the alleged abuse of a Palestinian detainee by soldiers in an Israeli prison. Middle East correspondent Eric Tlozek has been following the story and told The World that Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi will likely be charged with a series of offences, including an abuse of office.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: David Beckham receives knighthood from King Charles | ABC NEWS
description: Former England captain David Beckham has received a knighthood from King Charles in the presence of his wife, former Spice Girls member Victoria Beckham and his parents at Windsor Castle in the United Kingdom.  The newly-knighted Sir David Beckham said he cried when he found out he would be knighted.  The former Manchester United and Real Madrid star played 115 matches for England including in three World Cup tournaments and captained the Three Lions for six years.  Beckham also became an ambassador for UNICEF and contributed to the King’s Foundation.  The positive publicity came a week after the British monarch stripped his brother Andrew of his royal title over links to the late convicted sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein. title: Former US vice-president Dick Cheney dies at 84 | ABC NEWS
description: Former US vice-president Dick Cheney has died from complications of pneumonia and cardiovascular disease at age 84.  He was widely credited as the architect of the Gulf War under president George H W Bush and the driving force behind the US invasion of Iraq under the George W Bush administration.  The former Republican politician was also known for transforming the role of US vice-president into one of power overseeing foreign policy and national security after the September 11 terror attacks.  In his late years, he was a vocal opponent of US President Donald Trump and publicly declared his vote for Democratic candidate Kamala Harris. title: How Zohran Mamdani won over New York | ABC News Daily podcast
description: We want to hear from you! Please complete our survey: 2025 ABC News Daily Audience Survey (https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=mkDBl3hw50e7lNHlNQPgEpOxE0YscZ5Au4rK0pnU0zpURUxPU0ZaM0g0M1NaSEg4QVFVUFFKMVc4Uy4u)    Zohran Mamdani is a young, Muslim, Democratic socialist who’s a relative political novice.    But he could become the next mayor of New York City, despite a challenge from former Democratic Party governor Andrew Cuomo.    What are his policies and does he present a challenge to the politics of the president Donald Trump?   Today, Geoff Kabaservice from the centre-right think tank the Niskanen Center on how Zohran Mamdani managed to capture the attention of New York voters and whether he could be the answer to the Democratic Party’s woes.     Featured:    Geoff Kabaservice, vice president for political studies at the Niskanen Center

title: Commonwealth Bank labelled the ‘shonkiest’ company by consumer group Choice | ABC NEWS
description: The Commonwealth Bank has taken out a 2025 Shonky Award for refusing to refund $270 million in fees charged to low-income customers. The Shonky Award has been running for 20-years by consumer group Choice to name and shame “dodgy products, services and companies”. title: 350 people arrested in Brisbane crime crackdown | ABC NEWS
description: Suburbs in Brisbane's south have been targeted in the first month of a crime crackdown known as Operation Xray Steeler. 350 people have been charged with more than 1000 offences. They include drug and weapon possession, burglary, fraud, assault occasioning bodily harm, robbery, sexual assault, domestic violence and traffic offences. title: ASIO warns of assassination threats by foreign powers on Australian soil | ABC NEWS
description: Australia’s top spy chief Mike Burgess has warned three foreign governments will attempt to assassinate perceived political dissidents on Australian soil. However, he didn't go as far as naming the countries.  The ASIO director-general delivered a speech alerting Australians to security threats such as Russian trolls, extreme Islamists, far-right extremists, neo-Nazis and hostile state actors. title: Reddit and Kick added to Australia's social media ban for under 16s | ABC NEWS
description: Popular online messaging board Reddit and streaming platform Kick have been included in Australia’s social media ban for under 16s. Communications Minister Anika Wells has confirmed the two platforms are joining Snapchat, TikTok, YouTube, X, Facebook and Instagram, which includes Threads, as "age-restricted" from December 10. title: Who is Zohran Mamdani, the man who could become New York mayor? | ABC NEWS
description: Residents of New York City are casting their ballots in a closely-watched mayoral election, with Zohran Mamdani favoured to win. If he does, he would be the city's first Muslim mayor. The 34-year-old democratic socialist is up against 67-year-old Andrew Cuomo, who's running as an independent after losing to Mr Mamdani in the Democratic primary contest. It's one of several elections taking place, serving as the first major test of Republican Donald Trump's popularity since the 2024 presidential election.
